meanings.definition: Relating to the art of bookbinding.
meanings.sent1: The bibliopegic design on the cover of the book was intricate.
meanings.sent2: She admired the bibliopegic work on the antique book.
meanings.sent3: The bibliopegic craftsmanship on the novel made it a true work of art.
meanings.sent4: The bibliopegic touch added elegance to the book's appearance.
meanings.sent5: The bibliopegic details on the binding were skillfully done.

meanings.definition: A person who practices the art of bookbinding.
meanings.sent1: The bibliopegic carefully restored the ancient manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: The bibliopegic was known for their expertise in bookbinding.
meanings.sent3: The bibliopegic joked that they were 'bound' to their books.
meanings.sent4: She compared the bibliopegic to a magician, transforming books with skill.
meanings.sent5: The bibliopegic's hands worked magic, turning pages into treasures.
